results.title: Replanting the tree of life
results.brief_description: This award-winning program takes a stimulating look at trees from a variety of viewpoints. It not only shows the importance of trees to the environment, showing how the trees purify the air and process water, but also to culture, religion, industry, the economy and the future. Taking a global perspective, the program discusses the worldwide use of trees and the threat of deforestation. Suitable for Senior Primary and Junior Secondary students.

results.title: Repetitive strain injuries at work
results.creator_credit: Kim Dalton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the reasons for repetitive strain injuries and discusses the symptoms and treatment of RSI. Sufferers describe the activities which led to their injuries and doctors talk about methods of prevention.

results.title: Repeater away
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the laying of the trans-Tasman circuit submarine telephone cable between New Zealand and Australia in 1976. Written and directed by David Haythornthwaite; photography Kerry Brown; sound Julian Ellingworth; commentary Peter Gwynne.

results.title: Repairing Furniture
results.brief_description: Learn how to choose between white, yellow and hot hide glue, how to dissemble a piece safely and clean surfaces for glueing, how to clamp problem pieces, how to reglue or replace damaged veneer and how to mend broken parts and match missing mouldings.

results.title: Renoir on Renoir
results.brief_description: Film director Jean Renoir talks about the work of his father Auguste Renoir, the important impressionist painter, and of their home Les Collettes Cagnes-sur-mer in the south of France. It is shot in the house and grounds of the home which Renoir the elder painted many times and which is now a museum. Many of Renoir’s great works are seen there. Interview by Huw Wheldon.

results.title: Renmark on the river
results.creator_credit: G Shepherd and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents Renmark as Australia’s first irrigation settlement. Introduces the Renmark Trust utilizing the waters of the Murray River to irrigate fruit trees and vines. We see oranges prepared for market whilst other fruits include apricots, peaches, pears, lemons and grapefruit; and vineyards produce sultanas, raisins, and grapes for wine making. The scenic attractions of the River and town are also seen.

results.title: Renegade
results.brief_description: As Agent Renegade it is your mission to save the world from destruction by the alien monsters. This is a fast-paced action-packed game that plays on your reflexes and hand/eye co-ordination.

results.title: Rene Spitz: about his own work
results.creator_credit: Susan Sussman and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: A professional portrait of Dr. Rene Spitz, paediatrician and psychiatrist, largely based on footage taken on a visit to the Erikson Institute in Chicago, 1969. Dr. Spitz is best known for his work on the effects of emotional deprivation on children.

results.title: Rendezvous with destiny
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: This film strikingly conveys the destitution and despair of the depression of the 1930’s in the U.S. which gave rise to the election of Franklin D. Roosevelt and the “New Deal”. Footage shows dumping of milk to raise prices, children sleeping in the street, people living on the city dump, the march of people to Washington, troops attacking peaceful marchers, the right to organise unions and footage of striking workers at Ford with police firing on strikers. Written by Harold Flender. Narrated by Michael Tolan.
